Title: Insecurity: Governor Yusuf briefs President Tinubu on banditry in Kano
Summary: Governor Abba Kabir Yusuf has disclosed that the Federal Government is giving full attention to the security situation in Kano . Moves to deploy drones and logistics to protect border communities .

Title: Court rejects Kanu’s transfer request from Sokoto prison
Summary: The Federal High Court in Abuja declined to grant an ex parte motion filed by the detained leader of the Indigenous People of Biafra . Kanu was detained in Sokoto prison .

Title: NYSC to Partner Kano, Seeks State Intervention at Orientation Camp
Summary: The National Youth Service Corps (NYSC) has pledged sought area of partnership with Kano state government for mutual benefit . The NYSC appealed to the State Government to help address inadequate water supply at its permanent Orientation Camp located in Kano .

Title: Insecurity: Governor Yusuf seeks divine intervention, hosts over 4,000 Qur’anic reciters for special prayers
Summary: Governor Abba Kabir Yusuf hosted top Islamic scholars and more than 4,000 Qur’anic reciters for a special prayer session . Commends security agencies for restoring calm in Shanono, Tsanyawa, Bagwai .

Title: Management, parents bicker over N750,000 graduation fee at MAAUN
Summary: Management, parents bicker over N750,000 graduation fee at MAAUN . An unprecedented uproar has greeted a letter from Maryam Abacha, American University of Nigeria, Kano (MAAUN)

Title: Champions League: Osimhen leads Galatasaray attack against Monaco
Summary: Super Eagles striker, Victor Osimhen is expected to lead Galatasaray attack when they visit Monaco in today’s UEFA Champions League, UCL . The Turkish side are currently fourth in the Champions League table .

Title: Tinubu seized Benin Republic airspace legally — Senate Source
Summary: President Bola Tinubu requires at least 14 days to consult the Senate for approval in the event of troops deployment for combat operations in another country .

Title: EFCC reveals how Kuru, others used Arik Air’s N4.9bn to float NG Eagles
Summary: The Economic and Financial Crimes Commission tendered several financial documents before the Special Offences Court sitting in Ikeja, Lagos, on Monday . The EFCC alleges that billions of naira and foreign-currency loans belonging to Arik Air were diverted and used to establish NG Eagle Airlines .

Title: Insecurity in Nigeria, an industry — Obasanjo
Summary: Olusegun Obasanjo has expressed worry that the fight against Boko Haram in Nigeria has lasted longer than the country's civil war that took place between 1967 and 1970 . The former president expressed his concern that Boko Haram's fight against the terror group has taken longer than that of the country’s civil war .

Title: Dollar to Naira exchange rate today, December 9, 2025
Summary: The Nigerian Naira has maintained a relatively stable position against the US Dollar in both the official and parallel markets . Trading opens today, Tuesday, December 9, 2025 .

Title: Cross River gov's aide, LG chairmen trade blame over revenue, others
Summary: Senior Special Assistant on Media Research to Governor Bassey Otu of Cross River State, Phylo Odu, has accused local government chairmen of lacking transparency in revenue management, and nepotism in appointments . Odu said the chairmen have become disconnected from the people, citing their failure to renovate dilapidated LGA

Title: New voter registration hits 2.68m nationwide as Osun maintains lead
Summary: The latest figures place Osun State firmly at the top of the chart, as it continues to maintain its lead in the ongoing CVR . Osun recorded 208,357, followed by Kano with 159,669, Sokoto posted 152,650, Imo 145,561, Borno 123,835, Lagos 123

Title: FG seeks speedy trial of terrorists
Summary: The AGF made the appeal on Monday in Abuja during the ceremony marking the commencement of the Court of Appeal 2025/2026 Legal Year . The Minister of the Federal Capital Territory, Nyesom Wike, promised improved accommodation for judges .

Title: Tinubu orders rescue of 115 as Bago receives 100 schoolgirls
Summary: 100 school children abducted from Papiri Primary and Secondary School in Papiri, Agwara Local Government Area, returned safely to their families after nearly three weeks in captivity . President Bola Tinubu immediately renewed efforts to secure the release of the remaining 115 pupils and their teachers . With the return of 100 students, 115 students and 12

Title: Drug trafficking: India deports 32 Nigerians after crackdown
Summary: Indian authorities have deported 32 Nigerians linked to a transnational drug network barely two weeks after security operatives arrested about 50 suspects in a multi-state narcotics raid . Fresh reports from the Times of India on Wednesday revealed that investigators traced the network to a Nigeria-based kingpin identified simply as “Nick,” who is reportedly wanted
